body_html:
The newest is 0.1.11. Try that. The pip version also works. Yunqing
…
On 1 Apr 2017, at 7:10 PM, Rishabh Gupta ***@***.***> wrote: I am also facing the same issue and I am pretty sure that I have the most recent version of pytorch (0.1.10+ac) , can somebody resolve this issue ? My config : Linux .0-95-generic #142-Ubuntu x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux ` import torch torch.version '0.1.10+ac9245a' execfile("main_model.py") Traceback (most recent call last): File "", line 1, in File "main_model.py", line 123, in vgg.load_state_dict(torch.load(model_dir + 'vgg_conv.pth')) File "/users/gpu/arishabh/anaconda2/envs/opencv2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 222, in load return _load(f, map_location, pickle_module) File "/users/gpu/arishabh/anaconda2/envs/opencv2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 370, in _load result = unpickler.load() AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute '_rebuild_tensor' ` — You are receiving this because you commented. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.
body_text:
The newest is 0.1.11. Try that. The pip version also works.

Yunqing
…
 On 1 Apr 2017, at 7:10 PM, Rishabh Gupta ***@***.***> wrote:

 I am also facing the same issue and I am pretty sure that I have the most recent version of pytorch (0.1.10+ac) , can somebody resolve this issue ? My config : Linux .0-95-generic #142-Ubuntu x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

 `

 import torch
 torch.version
 '0.1.10+ac9245a'
 execfile("main_model.py")
 Traceback (most recent call last):
 File "", line 1, in
 File "main_model.py", line 123, in
 vgg.load_state_dict(torch.load(model_dir + 'vgg_conv.pth'))
 File "/users/gpu/arishabh/anaconda2/envs/opencv2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 222, in load
 return _load(f, map_location, pickle_module)
 File "/users/gpu/arishabh/anaconda2/envs/opencv2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 370, in _load
 result = unpickler.load()
 AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute '_rebuild_tensor'

 `

 —
 You are receiving this because you commented.

body:
The newest is 0.1.11. Try that. The pip version also works. 

Yunqing

> On 1 Apr 2017, at 7:10 PM, Rishabh Gupta <notifications@github.com> wrote:
> 
> I am also facing the same issue and I am pretty sure that I have the most recent version of pytorch (0.1.10+ac) , can somebody resolve this issue ? My config : Linux .0-95-generic #142-Ubuntu x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
> 
> `
> 
> import torch
> torch.version
> '0.1.10+ac9245a'
> execfile("main_model.py")
> Traceback (most recent call last):
> File "", line 1, in 
> File "main_model.py", line 123, in 
> vgg.load_state_dict(torch.load(model_dir + 'vgg_conv.pth'))
> File "/users/gpu/arishabh/anaconda2/envs/opencv2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 222, in load
> return _load(f, map_location, pickle_module)
> File "/users/gpu/arishabh/anaconda2/envs/opencv2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 370, in _load
> result = unpickler.load()
> AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute '_rebuild_tensor'
>
